title: Can you complete a story that starts with 'I never thought…'? - Quora

response.answer_text: “I never thought you would make me stand at this bus stop at this time of the night!!”, Ananya yelled on the phone to her brother Avinash. “I am on the way, just 5 minutes!!” Ananya's mind was restless due to a guy sitting in the corner of that bus stop, staring and murmuring something!! “Why did you ask me stand here? I could have stood inside the bus station”, Ananya was angry on seeing her brother. “You are returning after one month. Many things have taken place here since the time you left. Inside the bus station, many bad guys roam around so it is not safe. Here due to this guy, nobody would come!” He pointed at the guy sitting. “Why?”, Ananya was surprised. “His sister got kidnapped & raped at this very place. After that he has gone mad and he sits here every day. Their parents died long ago. Now some NGO's take care of him.” Her mind's tornado was suddenly arrested by sympathy!! She seized his glance in her mind like a caged bird. It's symphony ignited a spark in her heart!! With schintillating eyes and a subtle smile, she went with her brother.  “Why are you standing in this bus stop, Ananya? Let's go.”, Sidharth grabbed his wife's hands. “Just 5 minutes!!”, She stood there. “Why did you decide to marry me even when I was a mad guy who would always sit at this bus stop?”, Sidharth asked. “You lost your heart and your soul was bleeding. On that day, being a doctor, I only saw that.” He broke down into her hands, as those moments of bus stop and hospital floated around him with her smile bringing a dawn in his lonely dark horizon!!  Thank you for A2A, User-9436304335710962542 & Shreyash

"I never thought that it would end up this way! No! This can not happen! I never thought this time would come. I can not see you like this way, wake up! This can not end! " But was this really the end? The drops of tears hung by the eyelids, the stains of blood had colored his hands red, the sadness, the emptiness, the remorse, of leaving Monica alone, surrounded him. It all had him caught up in an ugly position, he couldn't help himself out of this void, but he had to get up! He just had to! Because it was time. Remember? He searched his pockets, looking for that envelope, he had always wanted to see what was in there, but now when he was going to do it, he did not want to do it. With shaky hands, trembling stained fingers and a blurry sight, he unfolded the envelop, took out the note and somehow gathered the strength to get started into reading it out. It was a worn out old yellowish paper, with a long text scribbled on it, the blue ink dried out to being an almost black, as if written under some pressure. "Hey Ross!" First words, and he couldn't go on any further. He could hear her in those words and it isn't a good feeling to hear the dead speaking up again. The emotions, the memories, the love, the past. It was all hitting him very hard. He was crying like a mad man, a man madly in love, he was acting like a lost child, a child crying helplessly. He even thought of throwing away this note and try not to hurt himself any further, but how could he? How could he let go of this last memory, this last note, this last conversation, maybe the last wish! He wiped of his fears and emotions and continued. "I know if you are reading this I'm probably dead or maybe fighting for life. Now that I am gone, with no explanation I suppose, with all your questions about me still unanswered.Here you are, still trying to know me, still trying to know why you fell in love with this woman. Honey, here you'll get the answers. I'm scared you might hate me for this, maybe you will think I did too much and I ask too much out of you, but you will help me, won't you?Because you're the only one whom I have actually loved, it was always difficult for me to trust someone, but I did trust you Ross, and I will trust you over this note also because I love you. " It was getting hard for him to go any further, The words were piercing right though his flesh, he was falling apart, but he had to continue, it was too late to back off now. It was time. "Do you remember the man we killed in Connecticut?The other man in the hat who we killed in the deserts of Sahara?The little guy who was sunk to death in the river?We were on a killing spree, weren't we?Why did you never question me who they all are?Yes you should trust me alright, I trust you too, but why didn't you ever ask me who they all are?Scared that I would never open up and shut you up like every other time?Well you were right in this, I would never have told you if you would have asked.But here we are, I am about to tell you what you never asked!" To be continued.. Feeling like missing something? Here is the previous part of this fictional account: Akshit Arora's answer to Can you write a story starting with the line "You love me, don't you?"?

“I never thought that you would ever love someone like me..Me asking that question was just a joke!” “I never thought you would take it seriously…and you yourself said that those rumors and jokes about you and me were not true..” Aashna said in disbelief. She was really taken aback. Two days ago something had deflated inside her when he had said that those were not true. But the next day..as she was coming out of the school washroom ,he was there near the aquifier filling the water bottle and had said; “It wasn’t true then..but it is now”. Aashna couldn’t get what he had said. She was an idiot in these things.Her knowledge was so vast but how couldn’t she get this simple sentence? So she asked him sheepishly; “Umm..what do you mean..I didn’t understand…” “What Aashna..you get so good grades in your test..and you can’t even understand the meaning of this simple sentence?” She pouted adorably and said” I DON’T KNOW WHAT YOU MEAN AND THAT’S WHY I AM ASKING YOU..IF I HAD KNOWN WHY WOULD I ASK YOU?” “Okay..calm down..I will tell you something tomorrow” ,he said,smiling a little. The next day as Aashna was coming out of the school campus,he came running to her and gave her a piece of paper. Aashna took it and as she started reading it,her eyes widened. She stared in disbelief and she was really taken aback, for in that sheet,it was written “My friends always come to me and say that they have fallen in love..I didn’t believe in it..In Love..but as I came to know you ..I finally knew what love is..I have never felt so strongly for anyone ever..I have never loved anyone..But I don’t know why,seeing you makes me smile..I love you Aashna..and yes..sorry for the bad handwriting..took me an hour to write this!!” Aashna smiled when she read this. She was so happy but she was quick enough to wipe her smile and say “ You know right..what happened to me..I don’t believe in love anymore..what if I say ‘No’ to you?” “ Then I will keep loving you more and pestering you until you finally say yes..even if I become a ghost..Mind you.. I will be a handsome ghost.” This time Aashna couldn’t stop her laughter. She loved him so much… TO BE CONTINUED.. Edit :Visit my answers to : Can you complete a story starting with “ I never knew…” and Can you share a romantic/ sad story and this is the first story of the three. and this is the first time I am writing stories..so please forgive me for any mistakes.

I never thought that one day I'll loose faith in something called 'being nice' . My hands quiver, all along the thoughts that run in my mind right now. It was one of the routine nights. As usual, I was driving home. Half way down, I noticed people crowded around a seemingly middle aged man, who was unconscious. I stopped my car beside. That man was drenched in blood. I heard a voice saying, “Spot! Spot dead!” I kneeled to look at him. “He's alive! He's alive!” I shouted. Yes, I felt his pulse. Next few minutes where like battling against a flock of sheep, who never give way to do something needy. These people never change. Nobody came forward to even help me carry him to the car. “Hold on! Hold on, brother! Be strong!” I mumbled in his ears. Soon, I drove to the nearby hospital. The staff responded quickly. An I.V line was started. Resuscitation procedures were done. The Doctor whispered, “Too late! But, we'll try our best!” I stood numb. My sight went hazy. I've no idea how next few minutes went. I opened my eyes to see fee people dressed in white around me. I heard a voice, “You, ok? Feeling better? Clearing my eyes, I whispered, “Yeah!” Little later, I got into my senses. I rushed to enquire about the person. “Fractured pelvis and skull. Internal bleeding in the abdomen. Absent light reflex. Very difficult!” They announced. I was shattered. Soon, the memories flooded in my eyes. How I met him in school- how we shared precious moments together- how we promised each other not to leave our sides, whatever might be the consequences- how we excelled in our respective fields. He's a Doctor, who works day and night just to see a smile on his patients' face. Oh sorry! He never addresses them as ‘patients’, he says ‘my people’. He has zero enemies. I've no eligibility to even say a word about his kindness. “He's no more! I'm sorry!” The Doctor, who was trained under my friend's guidance for past two decades, announced. All I could do was utter, “You're a cheat, my friend. You didn't keep your promise!” I cried. I cried. I cried. But, he never came back.  It's fiction.

“I never thought this would happen again”, Samaira exclaimed. Danish was alert. What would never happen again? Why is Samaira so tensed. Danish and Samaira started going out three years ago. It was love at first blink!(Yeah, that happens). They got married two years later and shifted to a new house. They had really happy times until that one day. It was Danish's birthday. Weird things started to happen. Danish's files were flying off the shelves, samaira's clothes were off the hangers. And that was not it. The basement was completely upside down. It seemed like you have entered a different world. These continued for days. Things did not come to rest. They called a priest and exterminated the entity in the house. Or so they thought. Another year went away and the same things started to happen again, only violently. Samaira was scared. She couldn't believe it was happening again. She was pushed in the shower and hit her head. While making dinner one night, she was forced to slice her palm. Even Danish wasn't spared. Every morning, his car would be covered with crows and their droppings. And his tyres would be slashed. His files would be shredded to bits and would be floating around the house as if their is no gravity working on them. This couple decided they had to do something about it. They tried a lot of things- holy water, prayers etc. But nothing seemed to work. It only worsened the situation. Losing their hope, they decided to leave their house. They thought after that night they would have a goodnight sleep from then, every night. It was around 3.15 am. Samaira woke up. She could hear water dripping from the taps. She turned and was going to wake up Danish only to find him missing. Her eyes drifted towards the closet where she thought she saw her husband. But there was a shadow. A shadow of a man with bloody red eyes and a crooked grin. The shadow was holding something. Samaira screamed on top of her lungs to see her bloodied husband's head in his hand. There was blood everywhere. He was coming for me. She was next. She tried to run and call for help. Everything became black all of the sudden. She could feel blood in her mouth. *Next Day* News: the stories of Maplewood creek hauntings seem to be true. The police found a severed head and body of the husband living in the house. There is a message written with his blood on every wall of the house. We'll meet again. The wife residing in the house is missing and only her toes and hair are left behind. On further investigation, the cops found the basement is completely upside down and it has split into two pieces.

I never thought Desire would try jumping off from our terrace. Desire is my 1 year and 9 months old Labrador. If it wouldn't have been for a platform under the edge from which he dived, I can not imagine what would have happened. I took Desire to our rooftop. The weather was cloudy and it could rain anytime, so instead of taking him for a walk outside, I decided to bring him up there. He is a mischievous dog, just like the ones they show in movies. He is super energetic and it's usually hard for me to hold him. Once, he jumped directly from our terrace to our neighbours’ without even getting a support from the wall in between. He enjoys doing that. So, I keep him tied to his leash to make sure he doesn't run away from there or even get hurt. We were pretty sure he did so because he was aware that there was a flooring on the other end and wouldn't hop around near any other edge. There were a bunch of monkeys around who kept his attention towards them intact. He was making me run along with him and kept howling like crazy. We did go to the edges, but just to get the view. That was when he pulled me at one of the corners and jumped across the wall. I'd not even try to dramatize it, just to make you understand. My heart did skip a beat, it really did. Thankfully, there was a concrete platform where he landed. I clearly do not know whether he was aware about that or not. I guess he wasn't. And that was the moment when I couldn't be any more grateful for everything. Luckily, brother was nearby and as I started screaming for him, he reached there immediately. I held Desire tightly by his collar and even his hand as I feared him slipping from there. Brother jumped over too, lifted Desire up ( Which again becomes hard as he's a restless dog) and placed him on my side. I did scold him a lot after coming home. But I cannot expect him to understand the seriousness of the situation, can I? We often overlook situations where we've been blessed deeply and keep on complaining about petty stuff. I'll never ever forget this incidence. To even imagine the other side of the story becomes a nightmare for me. Now I understand why we should be grateful for everything, at every point.

“I never thought of this even in my worst dreams” Leena said while wiping tears from her swollen eyes. The words of her parents echoed in her mind and were piercing into her heart like a ferocious sharp knife. She sat on the bench of park, gasping heavily for breath. “Why did it happen? Why me?” She cried while her throat choking. The lights in the park were turning on and off. Dark clouds invaded the sky. The wind blew harder and harder and slapped her gentle face. Boughs of trees swayed heavily and surrendered their dry old leaves to the mighty wind. Silence fell upon the park. Children left the park along with their parents. Holding their hand tightly. She looked at them and remembered how she used to run towards her parents and cry whenever the winds blew. The sky shook with thunder and unleashed torrent of water. She sat still, her eyes burned due to bullets of water drops. Suddenly, she saw something shimmering behind a tree. Her watery eyes stared at the blur image of shining object. She walked up to the tree and found an abandoned bejwelled tiara. An image flashed in front of her eyes. Her mother was setting the tiara on her head telling her how she was the best and most precious princess. The beautiful reminiscent was broken again by the sharp words. “You're adopted and not our biological daughter.” she uttered her parents' words in melancholy. But if they had hated me, they would never have treated me like a princess. Image of loving days with her parents started to unfold in front of her eyes. She thought to herself if being biological kid really matters. They never made me feel I was adopted. If they had, I would have guessed this long back. But I never even got hint of this! They loved and protected me more than anything else. Her eyes were filled with shades of many emotions. There was pain, but more than that, there was love. Love surmounted everything. Just when she held the tiara close to her heart, someone tapped on her shoulder. There were standing the two people whom she adored the most. She hugged them tightly and apologized for running away. They tightly hugged her back and said, “Honey, it's OK! We understand what you're going through. But remember, we love you more than anything.” “And I love you the most!” Leena said as her heart was filling up with love forgetting the pain. They looked up at the sky as the rain had stopped. Today, the moon was at its best. Starts felt to be glistening more brightly than any other day, may be because of the bond that Leena had with her parents became stronger than ever.

“I never thought I would see you again!” Kavya turned to see a man standing, surprised. “I am sorry! Do I know you?” “Of course! What kind of question is that Kavya?” “I… I... Am sorry.. I don't recall...” “That's rude! We were inseparable for years. I left to go out of the country and you forget my existence?” “Listen, there must be a mistake. I am not the Kavya you are......” “Kavya Iyer, St Theresa convent. Roll number 28.” Kavya stared at him open mouthed. “Please tell me who you are. I can't recall you.” “You don't? Really?” “Yes.” “Then you find out. I didn't expect this from our strict no-nonsense class monitor. Give me a call when you remember. But you will not have my number, as I just returned from US. How will you tell me then?” “I don't know..” Kavya said meekly. “Just the same old Kavya! I don't know.” He mimicked her. “Give your phone I will give you my number.” “No. Is this some scam?” “Scam? I am not taking your number I am giving you my number! Idiot! But no, you are the same old Kavya I used to hate in school. Bye.” He turned around to leave. “Wait. Give your number.” “No. What if you harass me? Men can't even complain to the police!” “Shut up. Tell me your number.” He blurted out and she typed. She gave a missed call on his number. “That's mine. I have class photos I will call you by tonight. I am good with remembering faces. I don't know what's gotten into me now.” “That's Okay, Kavu! See yaa!” He turned around and crossed the road. He went inside a cafe and headed to a group sitting nearby. “987654321 her number!” He revealed boastfully! “What the hell? How did you do it?” “You shouldn't just look at girls. You should hear their conversations too.” He said. “Meaning?” One of them asked. “She was talking about school life the whole time sitting at the next table. I wasn't just admiring her looks, I was also listening to her conversation. Kavya Iyer, St Theresa, Class monitor, strict and roll number 28 was all that I needed to get her number.” Want to know what happens next? Look up here. Shefali Naidu's post in Fiction Please!

“I never thought that life will be so much miserable for me, after putting in so much efforts for a good relationship, we separated because of something stupid. And now I don't know what future beholds for me ?”she was out in space last night. She got married six years ago, and was expecting the love like Mr. Kit and Cinderella have for each other in the fairy tale, and now she learned life is not a fairy tale at all, it's a cruel reality. She tolerated everything, which she doesn't deserve, but she did it for him as she wanted his love. She was hoping for a miracle. Now She don't want it anymore, because she know he never loved her truly, he has always doubted her for nothing. Yes!! For nothing. Being a Woman, being a mother and his wife she did nothing wrong. But he doubted just because she questioned “Why you are unemployed, why you are so much irresponsible, for what you have this MBA degree, why you doesn't have time to talk about our life and our kid's future. Though I don't have any problem if I am taking care of your expenses, but I need to spend time with our kid, I want you to work. I want to know you, share what's there in your mind, share if something is troubling you.” His answer use to be “Leave me, if you don't like me. I will be like this.” She thought he will be by her side on that disastrous night, but NO, he was there to blame her for something she haven't done. He left her helpless at that night of her birthday. He was her husband, but behaved as a rapist. She so wanted to make things work again, just in a hope that he will change and for their son too. But his ego and as he say 'mai mard hu' (I am a man) has ruined everything. That has taken away a child from a mother, they are judicially separated now and soon will have the divorce certificate. She ended up as a Mother with no kid.  This question has been asked by Shreyash Singh Chauhan today, approx 4 hrs ago. I know this might not sound like a story, but this is what I wanted to write as an answer to this question. The female in the content above is me. Yes its 14th June today, the 6th wedding anniversary and the first after the separation…….

“I never thought that you would betray me Karan”, said Rajesh sadly, whose proposal was just rejected by Payal. “Everything I told you was out of the trust. And you used those things to put me in trouble? Payal said ‘No’. Because you subverted her mind.” It was going to be a great day for Rajesh, as he was waiting for 6 months to tell what he felt about Payal, a co-worker in the company. He used to tell everything to Karan, his close friend. Even, Rajesh told Karan about his family background, the sad divorce of his parents and the life he lived since then. Karan had initially shown some sympathy to Rajesh as he wasn't interested in Payal at all. But as the time changed, Karan started having some feelings for Payal. Now, he used to tell wrong things to Payal about Rajesh. Poor was Rajesh, who didn't know this sabotage going behind him by his trusted aid. Karan falsely told Payal that Rajesh was a womanizer. Payal, innocent enough to fall in the trap of Karan, believed what he said about Rajesh. So, today, when Rajesh was to express his feelings for her, Payal slapped him and said, “I would die single than having a cheap person like you with me. Karan is hundred times better than a womanizer like you. With a broken family like yours, how can you expect me to spend a single moment? Better, forget me and don't ever dare to communicate with me.” The family thing was only told to Karan. So, more than her rejection, it was the family thing that hurted Rajesh the most. And he directly went to Karan, with a knife in his hands. Guess the further scenario- whether Rajesh attacked Karan? Or Rajesh cut his own vains? Or Karan attacked Rajesh?? Just a story…

I never thought of living without Shruti even for a moment, and here, I stand today, having spent 2 years of my life without the hint of her presence. The train’s speed dwindled as it approached nearer to the platform. I was standing at the gate, feeling the mild breeze gushing through my hair. I closed my eyes and tried to recollect some of the most beautiful memories I have of the city. I grew up here. It whiffs of my childhood, my adolescence and of Shruti - the girl I was ever so in love with. I still am. I tried not to think about her. But, as the train passed through the city, the sight of every little thing reminded me of her. The over-bridge where we had once sat together and smoked for the first time under the half lit moon, the grand ‘Landmark’ hotel where we had gone for a valentines evening, even the railway tracks looked familiar - somewhere on the same tracks, we had sit together innumerable times planning our future, her hand in mine.  The train gradually came to a halt at platform number one. I glanced at the board stating “Welcome to Gwalior” in bold letters. I wanted to feel welcomed but I didn’t. I recollected Shruti screaming at me to go away from her life, once and for all, leaving me with no other option but to abide. I reeled on the platform with a heavy baggage and an even heavier baggage of nostalgia and reminiscence. I hired an auto and asked the drive to take the longer route to my home, because the shorter one passed by her home and I didn’t want it to trigger a flood of memories, which anyways had already been triggered. I looked around as the auto drove through the hushed streets of the city. Gwalior is a city where nothing much changes. I have seen this city for 20 years and very little had changed over the time. And inside me, everything had changed in less than a couple of years. I was left barren and recluse. I don’t know where Shruti is, whether she is still unmarried or a mother to a daughter as beautiful as her, whether she is living entangled in those unfulfilled dreams alike me, or has already moved on and living our dreams with someone else, whether she still has my number and types a text umpteen times and discards without sending, or has deleted and forgotten my number long back. I wish I could ever find the answers, if the odds are in my favor.

“ I never thought that I was lucky enough to taste this dish again. Even my hopes of encountering with the same was dead long ago. You know, it was one of my most favourite dishes my mom used to make.” She said as she took first bite of a surprised dinner her husband had planned for her. She closed her eyes and begun to enjoy it. “How does it taste? Do you like it?” Husband asked. “It tastes like nostalgia, brings back all those sweet memories of my childhood and teenagerhood. My mom used to make exact same dish on holidays. It has the same taste, I must say. You should be very proud of yourself right now. Not most of husbands get appreciation from their wives.” Wife said with smile as she took another bite from the dish. “ Hence proved I can cook more than tea. Now, never raise your finger against my cooking skills ever again.” “Okay…. Baba…. Okay… I will never doubt your skills again.” She said holding her ears, asking for fake apologies. “Is this the big surprise that you were planning for me?” she added. “It maybe or may not be. Right now, why don't you just enjoy the food? Keep your brain on power saving mode and let your stomach do thinking.” He said with a smile on his face. “By the way, I am making tea. Would you like to have some?” “No..No…No.. I am fine. You help yourself. I will just finish the dinner then will take a bath.”  “Why is there two mugs besides tea-pot? I did say no to tea, remember?” Wife asked out of curiosity when she noticed a couple of used cups of tea on the table as she got out of bathroom. “Yeah. That's for me. I want to drink two cups of tea. I had headache.” He said holding his head. “That is so silly. You can drink twice from the same cup. You don't need two cups. That is idiotic.” “Yeah. Idiot, that's me.” “You know what I think, we should call an exorcist. I think you are possessed by some unearthly spirit. First you made a fabulous dish for me and that also without being confused between sugar and salt. Then I found the house as clean as heaven, I can literally see my reflection through floor tiles. Everything is arranged perfectly and exactly on places where they should be. You have even folded our blanket and made our bed perfectly. That's not it, even every fan, bulb and tube lights are dust free and our toilet…… awwww…. It smells so gooooood. THIS IS SO NOT YOU.” “Are you done with your deductions, Mrs. Sherlock? As far as I remember I haven't given you any birthday gift.” “Huh! So, what about it?” “Remember, the game you used to play in your childhood. The one in which your mom uses to blindfold you and tell you to find something and you always ended up finding your most….” “YEAH, ‘My most desirable things'! Actually my mom used to put it there. WAIT.. WAIT..WAIT.. I don't remember revealing this to you. How……” “Don't interrupt me wife. Today we are going to play the same game. I am going to blindfold you. Now seat tight on that sofa and don't move until I say.” He blindfolded her and told her to stand up after completing count to ten. She did the same and then started roaming in the room with help of her hands. Suddenly, her hands came in contact with a body, a human body. “Oh it's you. So, you are the surprise. I really expected some million dollar diamond necklace, my naughty husband. Well, I am gonna enjoy this gift whole night, hubby.” She said with naughty accent before removing her blindfold. Her eyes filled with tears as she saw the face of a person standing in front of her and then she heard laugh of her husband from behind. IT WAS HER MOTHER! “Well, aren't you gonna hug your birthday gift, girl?” Her mother said. “How?” She asked with teary eyes and chocked voice. “I got news that your step brother had sent your mother to an old-age home and I think you are aware of this. This was why you were upset. I tried to talk you out but you one stone-hearted never share your feelings. So, I decided to bring your mother to our home and to surprise you on your birthday. FROM NOW ON, SHE IS GOING TO LIVE WITH US.” She was just staring at the face of his husband, being sure of that ‘Angels do live among us'.

I never thought - I'll through myself out of the mirror! I never thought - I'll hate myself so much Did I tell you how much I love myself?? Well, you too told me that you love me like everyone used to tell me. Where are those words now?? Not your fault though, I have lost myself amidst of finding pleasure in my journey but - Everyday I go towards the mirror, try to look myself in the eyes of my VIRTUAL IMAGE but suddenly I take a turn, without touching my image, ignoring the same black eyes staring at me, asking me - Are you the same girl? Then out of fear, I lie down on my bed holding the green spinner, watching the cyclic motion of fan for hours, then I switch to watch the same ceiling which I don't think has changed, after hours and hours trying to escape from my VIRTUAL IMAGE, I muster all my courage and again walk towards the mirror. This time my eyes are wide open, trying to expell all the fear and I gave her a fierce look, but- Did I say she gave me the fiercest look? Again my courage got vanished. Then the series of watching same moving plates of fan, green spinner and same white ceiling starts. Did I mention how many times I did this?? Uncountable! Hours wasted, days wasted, months, years...I failed to win over my image! I never thought this mirror will squeeze the soul out of me and throw myself to the walls of reality that is full of truth, no lies, no virtuality, no another ME Did I say this loss of self -esteem is also termed as depression?

“ I never thought…. we will fight ever”, thought she. Tears were streaming down her face and soaking the pillow… Three months into marriage, theoretically they were still in the honeymoon phase, or that's what she thought. Till now, she often wondered why couples fight when they are so much in love. She was confident that such a situation won't ever arise in her case, as they were a perfect example of loving, caring and understanding couple. She was in total denial about the situation that happened that day, two hours back, when both of them yelled at each other. She was surprised as she had never seen him angry… and so was he. It all started with a very trivial matter. She had a bad headache since afternoon. In the evening, she didn't feel like cooking dinner. So, she called him…. but he didn't pick up the phone. Thinking that he must be busy, she messaged on WhatsApp, about bringing something from the takeaway for dinner,on his way home. But, the grey ticks never converted to blue. He finally arrived quite late. On opening the door, seeing him empty handed, she was pissed off. He told that he was busy in an important office meeting. Her complaining in loud voice and a bad tone, resulted in yelling , shouting and more shouting from both sides. After this sudden storm of quarrel, she went to the bedroom while he settled in the drawing room. There was no offering of cold water and hot tea followed by chatting and giggling about each other's day…while holding hands together. While drenching the pillow…she dozed off to sleep…and after a while she woke up startled. She looked at the wall clock. It was already 11:15 pm . ‘ he must be very hungry', she thought all of a sudden, I think I should fix something for dinner… something quick like sandwich or bread omlette. Then she went to the drawing room, wondering what he was doing, as she heard the sound of television. He was fast asleep…. over sofa. She looked at him. He was having a frown over face and was snoring softly… and looked like an oversized baby rather than an adult. ‘ I shouldn't have started the fight', she was filled with guilt. She had a sudden urge to cuddle him, but she restrained herself, overpowered by ego. Then she went to the kitchen and thought of making some dish which was his favorite. Kadhi chawal( a dish made with gram flour fried balls dipped in curd gravy, eaten with rice) would be fine, she thought. In fifteen minutes, it was ready. She served it at the dining table and woke him up. Quietly they had dinner. He asked for few more helpings of the dish which she served. ‘It's really very tasty', he told with a smile. She- 'so adamant and unapologetic….you can't even say a sorry’. He- ‘ sorry?…. but why?’ She- ‘ for the fight…of course’ He- ‘ but you were shouting all the way…. so you should say sorry'. She-' oh…really…. but what were you doing’. He - ‘ I was just looking at your face…. never knew you would look so beautiful when angry.’ She- (with widened eyes)- ‘ really…. was I?’ He - ‘ yeah… your whole face was flushed, cheeks light red.’ She ( happily) - ‘ oh….’ He- 'but the most remarkable was your nose…it had turned tomato red with anger… making you look like a clown' (laughing heartily). She (pretending to be angry while trying to control smile) - ‘ you are the meanest person on the earth… and I regret marrying you.’ She threw a cushion towards him. He - ‘ but you are the sweetest person on the earth… and I am lucky to have found you.’ He caught up the cushion and threw it back towards her. The cushion fight made them to forget the real fight. The ice of ego melted ,and the pathway of love was clearly visible! A perfect marriage is not a myth…. but it's all about accepting each other's imperfections and flaws…. and never giving up on each other and never keeping scores, no matter what. —-Dr Shashi

I never thought I would get this much used to my dorm room, that it would get harder to sleep even at my home. That last night I couldn’t sleep well. Something was intriguing me, something that extracts your peace from inside, something subtle. It’s just headache, I made myself believe. My family was concerned. I too was. Now it was 12 pm in the morning. I had just come back to Campus from home. I must be looking more like a dead person than the sleeping one. Phone bell rings. Soha was calling. “Are you good” she, unusually, forgot to say hi. “Yeah off course!” (Somewhere in my heart, I really wanted her to hang up the call). “And what about your boy?” She added. Okay so my boy had been my weakness for a long time. I love him. I love him till the bigger infinity. It felt good upon having “my” boy talk. “He is hawwwtt man”, I giggled in sleep. “Are you serious about him?” She asked me something that she asked often. “yeah! I am planning to work hard for our future to be together” “Is he, too, serious about you? “her questions were getting annoying now. “off course Yaar. What’s the matter? Why are you talking like that?” I tried to hide my anger. “The truth is , he has another girlfriend with whom he is serious and have planned even the marriage.” “Soha! Why should I believe you”? I wasn’t feeling bad. Everyone used to say such things about my boy. Everyone used to call him play boy. Only I knew him more than what they know about him. My boy was un comprehensive for them so they declared him bad. I was relaxed. Soha too would have heard this from somewhere and now she was suspecting my boy. I laughed somewhere inside me and slept again. He texted me few minutes later. “I haven’t eaten anything since the morning, come asap”. “Coming baby”, I left my sleep in the corner of my warm blanket and got up promptly. His unusual mood was telling how much he would have missed me. “you okay?” I teased him. “I want cigarette” mood remained the same. He always had cigarettes when something kept on disturbing him, I knew. “Okay! Let’s have one.” We went to “Qaashi ciggerete shop” to make his mood good. Nothing was being said during the whole walk. He was silent. We had out lunch together without uttering even a single word, unusual? Yeah too much. “let’s talk” he said. “about what?” “Okay! Leave it. so, what should be my punishment now?” he looked straight into my eyes.  To be continued…..

I never thought….the real meaning of life lies in the hardships of each day we live. It's not about tears only, it's not about smile only….life is a box of treasure. These treasures are our family, friends, career, health, failures and so much more. Stop criticizing of not having this and that, pay attention to those small things. From fan to air conditioner.From simple dresses to branded clothes.From scooty rides to car drives.From talking to few friends to texting in so-called whatsapp group.From sitting in the balcony of home to having dinner at lavish hotel.….don't forget at the end of the day you are living your own life. Each moment you are creating a story. For me, a story should be worth living as well as worth dying for. Few I NEVER THOUGHT moments are...  I never thought.... the midnight silence would be so acceptable to me. Sleepless nights not always signifies the pathetic emotional condition but they are the enlightenment to accept this very life as it is. Novels are the only mates who can talk to me, diary is the only friend who can listen to me. I finally understood such lonely moments are hard to tolerate but once they are lived trust me somewhere within we are changed... a change for betterment.  I never thought... the dawn is not only about silent sun rise. It's a start of a new chapter of our life's book. To wake up happily and wishing your parents is more soothing than receiving good morning texts from the virtual list of phone. To look into mirror and admiring oneself is more beautiful than wishing appreciation from others.  I never thought...people's behavior, words, promises eventually turns out to be absolutely fake and become the reason of ache. Pain of being left out is nothing but a stupid thought. I think the idea of making yourself worth achieving is wonderful. So not anymore let others be the reason of nuisance in your life. Bid them a goodbye and carry your life irrespective of others absence. Our own friendship with us matters a lot. So be your own good friend. Loneliness is horrible but that's what made me to differentiate between the true absence and fake presence.  I never thought....unreasonable, random, unexpected people and talks are more amazing than those whom we give reason. Go with the flow strategy is not bad after all. Enough of trying to hold the tides, let yourself flow and enjoy the ride. The day it will stop accept it and again get yourself get ready for new offering of life.  I never thought...what ever we endure is what makes us more strong, mature and lovable. Be happy for what you have suffered. Enjoy yourself… no one can ever steal your spirit of liveliness. Make your each day worth countable.  I never thought.... Life could be that much painful yet seems so beautiful now. :)(:

“I never thought you would do this to me!” I shouted at the top of my voice before bolting towards the door. “I can explain. Please wait!”,he ran after me and held my hand, “Please! Listen to me.” He looked at me with a furrowed face and teary eyes. “I don't want to listen to anything.” I yanked my hand off and left.  I saw him at the supermarket the next day. Messy hair. Baggy clothes. Puffy eyes. I wanted to talk to him. I wanted to hug him and tell him how much I loved him. But how could I? He had agreed to marry someone else. Days passed without talking. I wanted closure. In fact, I yearned for it. I also wanted to collect all my stuff from his house. I still had the key to his house. So the next day I broke into his house. As I scrounged through the living room I heard frail mumbling coming from the bedroom. I walked over to the bedroom only to find him sitting across from a girl. “You're gonna marry her?”, I said in the calmest tone possible while standing in the doorway. He got up, surprised. “How did you.... Uh... I... I'm sorry…”, he broke down. His parents who were in the next room heard us and came running to see what had happened. “Who is she?”, exclaimed his mother. “Oh! She's your mother, right? You both have the same I-am-surprised voice.”, I said, sarcastically. “Tell her to leave.”, his dad intervened. He paused for a moment, clenched his fists, stepped forward and held my hand. “No.”, he said, firmly. “What? You heard your dad. Tell her to leave!”, yelled his mom. “No!”, he yelled back. I looked up at him. Tears rolled down his cheeks. “We've chosen the best girl for you. You even agreed to marry her and she is way better than this girl.” his dad said, pointing at me. “I agreed to marry the girl of your choice just because I care about your happiness. But apparently you don't care about mine.” “We care abou-” “No, you don't!”, he cut his dad off, “I'm gonna marry her!”, he said, lifting my arm like I had won some kind of championship. “Let's go! Let him do whatever he wants.”, his dad exclaimed, looking him dead in the eye. He hugged me as soon as they left and cried like a baby. “I thought I'll lose you. I was scared. I'm sorry.”, he said after he recovered. “It's okay. We're good now. But your parents might not talk to you for a long time.” “I know but it's fine as long as you're by my side.” he said and kissed me.  Sidenote: Boys are allowed to cry. In fact, it's really cute when they cry.

I never thought I would be someone who can speak in front of enthusiastic audience gathered especially to hear me. .. And how could I think of this when I was aware only about the world I have seen around me- my farmer papa who works on the fields of others , my Amma doing more household works of Jamindar Kaka than ours and milking our buffalos, our small hut , small village who has only few houses. My daily routine starts from waking in the morning to sweep the floor made out of cow dung and than eating roti with onion and lassi , and then Seema gave me the call and we take our buffalos and goats to outside the village for grazing than to pond to bathing them and us playing with our dolls, decorating them , braiding their hair , and sometime we give a knot to our duppatas so that it can become saree like and we try to wear it , laughing on looking at the reflection in water , playing with five stones and talking about the things we know and see in that space, sometimes about the coming festival preparation and sometime about the memories of taste of ice cream we ate in last mela . Now we talk about breaking the glass ceilings but let me tell you there are girls exist , even now also who doesn’t have even a glass ceiling , all they have is ceiling made of concrete or iron where you can’t even see what’s happening in other side of world. I was one of them or even worse I didn’t even think that I had a ceiling at that time , I was fully ignorant and content in that activities. But as only one torch is enough to show you the path , in my case it was Sulochana Madam who become the light to show me the darkness I was being embedded. She came to our village for enrolling of girl child from the nearby town’s school and seeing her personality and talking ability something struck me. I wanted to be like her from that moment nothing more nothing less. and now as you hear me as the principal of the same school I once started in the dream of becoming the one like madam, garlanding our chief guest Sulochana madam , this is very emotional to me and my life has completed a full circle here.

"I never thought that my son would ever leave me in an old age home" murmured the old lady looking outside the window almost on the verge of crying. Days passed. Months passed. But that sadness never left her face. She looked cheerful only when Raj called her from US, but that too happened rarely. Apart from that, she used to stay silent & lost in her own thoughts. Her health was deteriorating day by day due to her age or her loneliness, I don't know. She was admitted in a hospital also, but destiny had sealed her future already… Raj was not happy as he regretted for leaving her there alone for the sake of establishing himself in the US. "I never thought I gonna lose my mom. I was planning to take her to US but.. but… it's all over" Raj uttered in a low tone. Misha(Staff of old age home)- Raj… You lost her that day when you left her here all alone. And you know what she used to wish… that her son will never go through the pain that she was going through. Her words pierced his heart but deep down he knew she was right... He ignored his mom for a career and now nothing left except guilt. He cried heavily but his mom was no more there to wipe his tears in her aanchal!!!

I never thought hope would take me places but here I am sitting in some aloof terrace top restaurant looking at hope. My mind goes back in time suddenly when she smiles at me. I am a 15 year old watching my neighbors peeping through their windows to hear my father shout at me and my mother. He was a beast at night and he smelled of rotten fruits. I run up to the terrace to find air and scream internally. I look around and decide to watch airplanes on their approach to land. It had become my hobby to identify the aircraft, identify the airline and cross check it with the airline schedule to find out from which city it took off. I can still hear my father scream but his voice is momentarily shut down by the planes that pass over me. I thank Delhi airport for being such a busy airport. My mind is back to her now. I am sitting in front of her like a jet-pack ready to be fired. I can see fire-crackers in her eyes and I want to burn my hands in them. My mind wants to travel back in time again but the song on the dilapidated speaker changes, and I decided to hear it and focus my vision on her eyes. The sky in her eye was lit with the grandest of crackers possible and I wanted to be a privileged spectator. I'm not a stranger to the darkHide away, they say'Cause we don't want your broken partsI've learned to be ashamed of all my scarsRun away, they sayNo one will love you as you are[1] I am a 21 year old traveling in a general compartment from Agra to Bhopal. There are around 150 people stuffed in the compartment for only 64 people. I am hanging near the door and people are struggling to get inside the toilet, and every time someone opens it, I feel like jumping out of the train. I had no clue why I was here or where I would go thereafter. In the distance, aloof from the dry valley the train was passing through, the sun was setting and spreading saffron on us immortals. Something inside me hurt but I have no hint as to where and why? My mind is screwing around with me. I came back to the present and the song is still playing in the background. She was not there anymore, I looked around but there was no scent or visual. I sat down and called the waiter to order more food. Another round of bullets hits my skinWell, fire away 'cause today, I won't let the shame sink inWe are bursting through the barricadesAnd reaching for the sun Yeah, that's what we've become I have no clue how old I am but I am walking in a jungle with a torch in my hand. I was in the jungle of seven sisters. The locals had told me that it is haunted and I wanted to experience horror to numb the pain I had inside me. I sat on a rock and waited for a ghost to come, I wanted to be scared so that I could forget everything for a moment but just like my fortune, the ghosts betrayed me. I did not sleep the entire night and kissed the first rays of sun with gloomy eyes and a sore back. I wanted to stay back in the hope of seeing a ghost to overcome the the ghosts of my past but I walked away towards the village below. She was back while I was mindbogglingly boggling inside my mind. The smile rested in front of me. The fire crackers had stopped but I could see blue skies in her eyes, it was calm and serene. She said something but I could not hear as the song was too loud. I am who I'm meant to be, this is meLook out 'cause here I comeAnd I'm marching on to the beat I drumI'm not scared to be seenI make no apologies, this is me The year is 2034. I am on the top of a mountain holding a pen and paper. At my feet, a few puppies are eager to lick my clothes and in the distance their parents are fetching ball. The sun is rising and with it I rise from my seat. Behind me is a small cottage with wooden logs at the entrance decorated on the steps. The morning had an aroma of happiness and the dew on the grass were reflective. In one of the drops, I saw that smile again. I immediately turn behind, her hair has a shade of grey but her smile has not died a bit. She kissed me on the forehead and looks at the script I am holding in my hand. The puppies shift their attention to her, she was the mother of everything around here after all. I am back in my seat and she is still talking like I am the only person who exists around her. I interrupt her to order a drink. And I know that I deserve your loveThere's nothing I'm not worthy ofWhen the sharpest words wanna cut me downI'm gonna send a flood, gonna drown them outThis is brave, this is bruisedThis is who I'm meant to be, this is me “I just saw the future and I saw that I was really happy in it. Can I hold your hands please?” She did not move or speak so I held her hand anyway. “You were in the future, in mine and I was in yours. I know it was just my mind playing games but I guess now I am letting my heart play games with me. I have no hint as to what you will do next but I think there cannot be anything better than you giving me a free show of fire crackers in your eyes every evening throughout my life.” She just nodded. I never thought… Footnotes[1] https://www.azlyrics.com/lyrics/greatestshowmancast/thisisme.html

“I never thought loving you would be so difficult.” She said as they walked with laced fingers. “I know. We've been so strong that even the strongest storm in the world can not separate us from our love for each other. I've been with you through thick and thin. Light and dark. Black and White. And thus I've seen every part of you,every side of your nature yet I think there's so much left to explore. So much more to understand and so many things I'll never know,for eg, Why you prefer black coffee over milk coffee when it's so bitter and you absolutely love sweet. Why you sleep hugging your pillow.” “Hey!!! Stop sneaking a look at me while I'm asleep.” She frowned. “Creep.” She laughed. “But seriously,I love black coffee because I love people the way the are,raw and bitter, just like I love you without any filters. Adding milk to coffee eradicates it's true nature upto some extent thus making it fake. I like real and raw.” She looked at him in the eyes. Had those eyes not been mirroring his love for her, he would've thought that his love was too passionate and too true. But seeing the same feelings in her eyes, he knew it was not enough. “I hug my pillow when you're away. I need someone to hold on to. It had been nothing when you had not been around. But with you, it's just you.” He looked at her and say those eyes gleaming with fresh tears. He knew her past and she knew his. Stroking her cheeks,he kissed the tear away.  Image source- Google
