I never though I would be deserted like that…sigh… I start driving; I don’t have any other option. I am just looking here and there, hoping to find someone or rather someone I knew but the road was just empty. “Your destination is on your right” “Huh...” I was just so absorbed in thought that I didn’t even realize that I had reached my destination. I looked to my right. There was some sort of a shack. I went up to the door and knocked. No one answered. I don’t see anyone inside either. I decide to call Deep. “Shit, there is no signal here.” Now that I look back at that moment, I think I could have messaged him but I was just stupid. “Ooh, I’m not the only stupid one here” exclaims Bryant. “Whatever anyway let me continue?” “Sure, Grandpa” I remember I had some tools in my car, I get back to my car and pick up a spade. I had decided to break open the door. I take a few steps back and charge at the door with all my might. I hit the door as hard as I can. It starts crumbling. I take another hit and the door collapses. I look inside, there is no one. “Ugh! I can’t believe Deep left me all alone” I start heading back to the car and thinking that I would have to frive to Delhi all by myself when something caught my idea at the corner of the room. It was a shotgun. I decide to investigate it. Looks in good condition. A bit heavy than that what it seems in video games but it will do. I also spot some ammunition and dump all that in my car. My new friend, the shotgun is sitting in the front seat with me now. It had started getting dark. I glance at my watch. 1900 hours. I decide to stay over at Chandigarh today and head for Delhi tommorow the first thing in the morning. I eat some chips, scroll my phone untill I finally decide to sleep. It was probably the longest night of my life. I wake up at dawn. I remember how I used to wake up early to study before examsas. “Ahh, those were the days...” I see my phone. 4:08 am I look outside, still hoping to see someone but all I see are some birds fighting over food. I decide to start the journey to my penultimate destination. I get on the highway and spot a grocery store. I pick up some food. The electricity, surprisingly was still running. I immediately charge up my electronic devices. Something weird happens. A car stopped on the highway as soon as I was about to leave. A person gets out, wait...It’s not a person...  ~Kayvour

‘’I never thought you would leave me in the middle of chaos.’’ I still remember the day we met. You were new to the school. You always entered the class room carrying an umbrella with you. On a fortunate day you came to me and asked ‘do you have an extra pen, I have lost mine’. The day which brought me a friend for life -at least I thought so. We started sharing bench, then food, then all our secrets and in no time we became best friends. We were always there for each other. We laughed together, bunked our classes together, got punished together. Whenever I cried I have seen you crying with me. You were the only solution to all my problems. You were my everything. Then one day you just left without saying anything to me, to your best friend .I read your suicide note next day in newspaper. Do you have any idea how I felt. I never knew you had so much hidden inside you, I thought I know in and out of you. But I was wrong. You lied to me. Everyone started asking me –why Swati committed suicide? And I was not having anything for them. Two days after the incident I found your last note for me in my bag it says- Never change yourself for anybody, always be the way you are. You are the only best thing ever happened to me. I have to leave. Sorry. BFF Swati And then I cried, but this time I was crying alone, you were not there. I realised you left me forever. I have lost you, I have lost my everything. I need you and I miss you. Some nights I can’t sleep because my mind is consumed with the thought of how much difficult your life was and what made you do this. And how I am sorry I couldn’t help you.

“I never thought I would see you again.” Samar spoke in his mind while looking at Sana his ex girlfriend at the restaurant. She was with her new found love holding hand in hand. Seeing Samar staring at her with a deep grief on his face, Sana acted more goofy, getting more closer to her new boyfriend. Samar was standing there staring for few seconds but soon he realised her worth in his life. “She is dead for you Samar, move on man.” His mind spoke firmly. He finally walked off and sat on a table alone remembering all those happy days with his past love Sana. He controlled his anger, faught his tears and smiled seeing Sana happy with her new found love. Suddenly, a sweet voice came from behind echoing in Samar's ears like someone pore honey into it. “Excuse me, can I sit here as there is no other place left to sit around.” A girl spoke in a sweet, polite tone. Seeing her standing with a tray in her hand, Samar lost instantly in her mesmerising charm. He nodded his head and she sat in front of him wearing a bright white t-shirt with a tiny mole near her lips which made her beauty compare to those shining distant stars. Both looked at each other like they have met before. She smiled and greated him while Samar also wore a slight pleasent smile on his face. “Life isn't that bad it seems.” Spoke Samer in his mind seeing this new girl sitting in front of him who rejuvinated his notion of love once again. Yes, life gives a chance again, hence remember whatever happens, happens for the best.

“I never thought i would ever write a story on quora. Here's how i did anyway. I never would have believed I would be able to finish a story on quora. As I always wanted to write about something, but writting was so difficult for me. In middle School, i never focused on such thing and that same happened in the high school too. And yet, here I am, trying to be better at writing. How ironic. I had such a hard time writing that I majored it in during my CAT journey. I felt that if it couldn't help me, nothing could. I still continued to struggle to write even basic pieces. THE EXACT REASON FOR MY WRITING STRUGGLES. Here was the problem: I would spend most of my writing time not writing. I would stare at the page, lost in thought, Trying to come up with perfect sentences before I wrote them down. And if I couldn't come up with those perfect sentences in my head, I would skip off to scroll FB. This is still true, by the way, I often still struggle to write even a few hundreds word a day which I'm not familiar with it takes me far too long to write anything. I sometimes make it my goal to simply write 100 words per hour. That means to finish a 500 words article, might take me as long as 5 hours.

“I never thought I would agree for an arranged marriage, but I had to” Siri’s loathing of arranged marriage was palpable. Siri had been dreaming about love marriage, thanks to the inspiration from her favourite movie Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, but those dreams were shattered by her parents’ You-know-nothing mindset. Bharat Matrimony app’s notification flashed on Siri’s father’s mobile screen. “Matches suitable to your requirement” said the notification. He opened the app and went through all the matches suggested by the app. His wife was also helping him in selecting her to-be-son-in-law. They would see the profile picture first, next they would scroll down the details and at last they would see the score of his details to their requirement. It seemed to Siri the entire process as an election for MLA seat, where Election commission was Bharat Matrimony, Candidates were the persons registered in Matrimony site, the voters were Siri’s parents and finally, Siri was the Seat. It also appeared to her that entire process was similar to shopping in Amazon, where we look at the picture of the product first, next we scroll down to features and at last we see the rating of the product. However there are two differences, one, in Matrimony you don’t have reviews as appear in Amazon and product will not be delivered to you, you have to go the product. Finally, they liked one profile as it was almost satisfied all their requirements i.e. Job, height, food habits, horoscope etc. They dialled the number given in that profile and put forth marriage proposal. Siri kept open slightly her room door to eavesdrop the conversation. After cutting the call, they called Siri and informed about the guy in that profile. They showed her the profile picture. Not bad not good she thought. “Meet him in person. Spend some time with him. If you say ok, then only we will proceed further” Siri’s father words echoed in the small dining room. You didn’t allow me to love anyone as you said it clearly before joining in college. You ruined my dream. Now, you are asking me to betroth the guy of your choice. You are asking me to meet him, spend some time with him and tell my opinion. How can I tell my opinion on a guy in one day? 40 years life dad, how I can decide in such short span of time She wanted to shriek out the words but she only managed to mutter out “Ok, papa”. She was waiting in a shopping mall for her to- be-affianced. His name was Sravan. She was looking at the picture in phone and looking at the people coming into Café Coffee day continuously. Sravan was in black blazer, black pant in profile picture. She was imagining how he would show up today as today might be his biggest day. “In ground floor. Two minutes” a message flashed on her screen. Her adrenaline was shooting up. She was looking at the door unblinkingly. Door was opened by a somewhat familiar person and came towards her and sat before her. He wore a black short and white t-shirt, hair was dishevelled. She was perplexed. “Hello” Sravan greeted in a formal tone. ”He…ll…ooo” greeted back Siri. She thought he would come in a nice dress but what he wore now shocked her. “Have you ordered anything?” Sravan took the menu card. “Nnnnnnooooo” Siri was still in baffled state. “What do you want Siri?” Sravan looked at Siri, who was looking at the phone and scrolling left and right continuously. She looked up and said “Vanilla Cappuccino”. He again went back to menu. She was looking at him and looking at the pictures continuously. “One classic cappuccino and one Vanilla Cappuccino” He ordered. He kept menu away and looked at her and she turned her sight away immediately. “Don’t be confused between my profile picture in Matrimony app and my appearance now. This is original me. I wanted to be truth and honest to my would-be. This is my 6th meeting. I appeared only like this in last 5 meetings. Some liked me and some didn’t. The Sravan in that picture is after wearing a nice dress, after combing hair neatly, after applying filters in Photoshop. That pic was artificial and I am real. I told my dad to remove the picture but he didn’t. I like being natural.” a detailed explanation from Sravan brought Siri to normalcy. “That’s great” she said after a long deep thought. “Am I looking good or bad in person when compared to me in profile picture?” Sravan asked her with a smile on his face. “Naturals are always look good than artificials” She replied him with a warm smile on her face. A round dimple was formed. Beverages were served. For the next one hour, they talked about their jobs, families and future plans. Sravan felt bored of that topics. “I am bored of these topics. Shall we change the topic?” Sravan frowned. “Hmm. Yes. Ok, tell me do you have any past?” Siri asked her most interesting question as she loved love stories. “No” “Really?” “No” “Not even girlfriends?” “No” Who on earth doesn’t have past now a days. Now only you told that you would be honest to your would-be. I fear you are not She wanted to tell him on his face but couldn’t. “My philosophy is very simple Siri. At the end of the day, I have to marry only one girl. If I love anyone, there will be no guarantee that I would end up in marrying her, particularly now a days where break-up ratio is more than love marriage ratio. I talk more with my sisters. They are my best friends. I talk with girls in my office as it is necessary to do my work. I have my best male friends, with whom I go to movies, shopping, tours and everywhere. I wanted my wife should be my lover, best friend and everything. That’s why I am single” again another detailed explanation from Sravan clarified her doubt in mind. Sravan got a call when Siri had decided to ask another question. It was from ICICI bank customer care, pestering Sravan to take a home loan. “Sorry Mam, I don’t have the requirement as of now. I will be getting married in another six months. After marriage, if I require home loan, I will definitely approach your bank. Thank you for letting know me the offer. Have a good day. Bye” Sravan politely finished the call. “If they are pestering like that, why don’t you cut the call on their face?” Siri shot another question. “It’s their Job Siri. They have to do it like that only. They have targets to accomplish, otherwise, they will get scolding and less hike. One of my sisters was working in a call center temporarily two years back. One day, one customer was insolent to her when she tried to convince him. He cut the call on her face. On that day, she called me and cried and sobbed for almost thirty minutes. It’s not their personal nature, their job made them to pester like that. From that day onwards, I started to be polite with them just like I was few minutes before” another detailed explanation from Sravan made Siri understand him as a mature guy. “Do you………………. drink?” Siri asked him hesitantly. “No. But I will after marriage” Sravan said immediately. Siri was shocked and it was palpable on her face. Sravan smiled and continued “One of my dreams is to drink a beer on first night along with my wife. Another dream is to help my wife in cooking. There is no meaning in sitting in a hall and watching movie when my beautiful wife is preparing food in kitchen” Smile appeared on Siri’s face and Siri started liking him. “I have been asking questions continuously from beginning. Don’t you have any questions for me?” Siri moved back in chair and sat straight as if she was sitting before interviewers. “No” “Why?” “I believe my gut feeling. It is saying you are made for me and we will make a good pair. And, my gut feeling has never proven me wrong till today” “How does your gut feeling come to this conclusion?” “Very simple. The primary logic is your qualities and mine are perfectly matched in Matrimony site. Another one is you are the only one who sat for more time than the previous ones” She started liking him. “If we get married, you should bear my questioning attitude” Siri told cutely. “There it is, third one” Sravan smiled wholeheartedly and continued “of course. I will happily bear. After all, you are a journalist and I am a psychiatrist”  Thank you for reading Vema reddy G

I NEVER THOUGHT..I would feel this helpless…… Let me give you a brief intro about myself. I was a 19 year old, happy go lucky kind of girl, never cribbed about the negatives of life. I was always a dreamer…. I was determined to live my life to the fullest. Nothing could stop me… Nov 30th 2017, ‘AESHAAAAAAAAA’ screamed a quivering voice. “WAKE UPPP” It was pouring cats and dogs. I felt every drop that hit me like rocks. It was dark so I couldn’t see very well. I squinted my eyes and… Saw a Girl….. Lying on the other side of the road…..I could hardly see what was going on. There was a boy on his knees right next to her, shaking her vigorously asking her to wake up. I could see the diluted blood everywhere…. Seeping its way across the road. I thought I should help… Ran towards them screaming, “what’s wrong”. The boy ignored me Trying to calm him down, Looked at him sympathetically….. I was shocked to see that it was my brother… My own flesh and blood. Chotu? I thought. Confused and Horrified.. I looked down at the girl lying dead….. It was ME. I died before living to the fullest… “Nothing could stop me… at least that’s what i thought….”

“I never thought I could write a story that begins with “I never thought””, muttered he as he engaged in a soliloquy with his reflection in the mirror. The guy in the mirror replied, “That’s the problem man, you never think that you can do; but what you do think is that you can never do.” He told his alter mirror self, “Nice play of words man!” and grinned within at the thought of having had a thought that originated in his mind which he got to hear from his alter ego which in effect was himself. His hypothetical alter ego interrupted this thought of his; he spoke to snap him out saying, “ Enough appreciation for the self. We’re discussing something serious here.” He got the jolts and came back into the conversation saying, “ Yes, you’re right. What were you saying? Can you please come again? ” His alter ego let a heavy sigh of exasperation and replied in a cold dispassionate tone, “ I said you think you’re never good enough to do something; but what you don’t realize is that, you prove that by thinking you’re not good enough and subsequently avoiding action, you’re in fact great at thinking and implementing the thought that you’re not good enough every single time! which means you’re good enough to implement your thoughts, so then why are you consciously not indulging in the act of thinking that you’re good enough and act accordingly?” Now, after having heard that from his alter ego with a penetrating stare and in an emotionless tone, he was convinced that he needed to think why he always curbs his instinct to “THINK” about which he’d never thought before. So, he again prompted himself to think why was it exactly that he never thought about “Thinking” seriously? His alter ego was now convinced that he had planted the right seed in it’s subject’s mind and that he’ll now ruminate over it and eventually get to an answer so he gradually faded away as his subject continued to ponder on the question raised in his mind…

“I never thought I'll be here someday.” said the lady crying and kneeling down on the stage floor. The people nearby just stared at her. Only a girl came to wipe off her tears and said “You have to be happy. Mumma says we should not cry.” said the 3-year old daughter of a martyed army officer. The 3-year old received the Ashok Chakra Award and said to the audience “My mumma is strong and so should you.” Little did she know that her mumma was strong.

I never tought you would show up. Yet, here you were in front of me. I was looking in your eyes, they were confused and looking around. Your body trembled a little bit, you were scared. I was confused too. You weren't expected to come, your friend was! So why were you here? It wasn't time or place for you to be here, you weren't supposed to see me or anyone here. Your friend was. You looked at me, you saw me before, but, I don't think you remember me. You were young when I saved you, so young that you barely knew how to talk. That was when you met me for the first time, but I knew you before that, I knew you since you were born. I mean, I was assigned to look out for you and your future, to guide you through dark and give you hope. But still, I didn't want to see you here, I wasn't even expecting you! Your friend was supposed to be here, in front of the gates with me. But I had to tell you where we were and who I was. It's better if I tell you, your guardian angel.

“I never thought you would forget this day,”Shreya spoke trying to control her emotions. “ What? Today? “ Adi’s voice echoed shock. “NOTHING” Shreya could not stand Adi beyond that and she disconnected the call. Adi and Shreya study in same college in same department. With the lesser strength of class, it was not a wonder to know each other soon. They seldom texted each other. But a boring day with a boring presentation, created incident for Adi and Shreya text each other. It never took time for both of them to share common interests from movies to books. Soon, texting each other and briefing of daily happenings became an everyday task. Shreya felt herself getting possessive of his friends spending time with Adi. Few misunderstandings started cropping in. Adi could also not comprehend the change in behaviour of Shreya. Adi tried to talk to Shreya but in vain. Shreya convinced herself that she is needlessly worried about Adi’s friends and Adi cares her more than them. But Adi never expressed his feelings for her. It was an unusual day when Adi told Shreya that he wants to treat her for lunch. Shreya couldnt turn down his call and accepted his offer. Shreya least expected him to present her earrings and confess her he loves her more than she loves him! Shreya couldnt believe she is in reality and nodded her head. Shreya’s mobile screen flashed Adi’s name. Shreya looked at her mobile and hesitated to pick his call. She couldnt forgive him. But her anger subsided after few rings from Adi. “Tell, I m busy”, Shreya burst out. “ Shreyaaa, its difficult to remember all days”, Adi said worriedly. “I never thought you would forget, the day we texted each other.. Dont talk to me”, Shreya reacted playfully.Adi cluelessly agreed and cut the call after 2 hours. !

“I never thought I would come across him,again, thought Meethi,as she found herself looking at Karan,standing and talking to a few acquaintances. She was at the reception of a reputed Hospital in Delhi. “I must get away from here,as soon as possible.Jagath sir will just have to excuse me for this time.” She just made a move,when she heard that voice,his voice,calling her. “Meethi Sharma?” “Shit yaar!”.She turned,with a nervous smile plastered on her face. “Here he is.All the same”, she thought, when she saw the 6-feet tall ,mouth-wateringly handsome figure walking towards her. “Is this the Meethi Sharma I know?From St.Xaviers?Oh my god!” “As if he doesn't know me”, she thought. “No Mr. I am her doppelganger.Duhh!What the hell are you doing here?” “Wow. So rude. It is something personal. Any complaints,Ma'am? Meethi chose to stay shut.She knew that this guy, Karan, once hers, was capable of stealing her heart once more. “You are still the same, Meethi.” “I am not. I've already said that.Everything is…fine. I'm fine.” “Who are you kidding? What do you want to prove, Meethi? That you are happy without me? That you currently have a boyfriend? Then I'm sorry to burst your bubble,sweetheart, I don't believe in any of that bullshit. You are the same Meethi with whom I shared a special bond. We were the ones who read The fault in our stars together, and we were the ones who discovered a new universe in each other’ s eyes. We were the ones who stole glances in class, and imagined a new life of stars and fireflies. Why did it have to end, Meethi? Why did you go leaving me alone? You owe me an explanation. Meethi couldn't be more desperate. He didn't know how she wanted to run into his arms and sob. He didn't know what she was going through. “I can't.” she whispered. “Why? Damn it!Why can't you just say it?” “Because I have uterine cancer!I'm a cancer patient, Karan, and I didn't want to be a grenade. ” Meethi looked up. Karan’s eyes met hers.Her eyes fluttered down. Nothing is ever gonna be the same again.She has lost him again. She is a grenade. “You're not. You're not a grenade, Meethi. You will never be. My heart was, is and will be with you. It is an honour to fall in love with you, Meethi Sharma.Will you be mine again? Meethi’s eyes overflowed, this time, with joy. But she pouted, and shook her head in denial.Karan looked flabbergasted. “First, buy me an ice cream, na. The tender coconut one. Missed it more than I missed you.” “Aahan?”he challenged. She blushed. She was right. Nothing is ever gonna be the same again. Everything is gonna change. For good, this time. Edit 1:Thank u Keerthi Manikanthan for suggesting the edits.

“I never thought I would see you again”, said Shreya with a happy face. “I told you, I will come for you Shreya”, said Shyam. “But she told you will never come!”, said Shreya pointing at Shruthi. “No baby, I can’t be without you!”, told Shyam and hugged her. Both had happy tears in their eyes. Shruthi looked at them and felt so happy that she and Shyam decided to work on their marriage for their cute little child Shreya. They sorted out their relationship and lived as a happy family ever after. Have a great day! :)

“I never thought you have a feelings for me.” Divya said with low tone. “I am sorry Divya but I am unable to control my feelings.” Aman replied in apologetic tone. “But Aman, one sided love is self destructive, so I thought this is our last meeting.” Divya said with teary eyes. “Divya, please don’t go. Please don’t ruin our beautiful friendship.” Aman replied. “I am sorry Aman! But it’s over. You already know that I am commited to Raj, then how could you do this? I am really sorry.” Divya said. “Are you going? Thank you so much.” Aman replied (tears in his eyes) “Are you crying?” Divya asked. “No! I am not, I just want to say that just keep smiling. Your smile is one of the cutest thing I have ever seen.” Aman replied. And Divya left him without any good bye. On a next moment Aman opened his mobile phone. His tears making mobile's screen wet. “You are my best friend, never dare to leave me.” “I will kill you, if you tried to ignore me again.” Aman typed last message. “What was my mistake?” And he deleted her chat and blocked her. Don’t fall in love with your best friend. You lose two persons in one moment. Keep smiling :)

“I never thought this vidai ceremony will break me.” Seated inside the decorated car, Meera the bride said those words with tears in her eyes. Her husband, Raj looked at her tears. He didn’t say anything for like two minutes. Two minutes later, in a strict tone, Raj said, “Cry as much as you want,” Meera felt surprised when she heard those rude words from Raj. For a moment, she paused and looked at her husband Raj. All suddenly, Raj turned his angry face into a happy face, took a hold of Meera’s hand and added, “Because, after tonight, I won’t let you cry, ever!” Those words delivered a smile to Meera’s face and she hugged her hubby. The eighth vow of marriage was taken after the vidai ceremony.

“I never thought that I'll get to meet you, I had lost all the hopes.” Kaaya Devi finally spoke after a long silence. “Don't you think this is too early to talk this, you have waited for this moment since years. I didn't escape those terrorists to hear this. Ma! You are the inspiration that kept me going , this much that I forgot to look back because my country needed me on the front.” Vinay could only say this. “Being a soldier is not simple, and being the mother of a soldier is very tough. It's not only the soldier that sacrifices, it's the family too who has to sacrifice a lot too. Living with the fear that any moment can bring the news of his son's martyrdom is not a simple task either.” Kaaya Devi almost sobbed. “Promise me something ma..” “What..?” “If something happens to me in the battlefield, you will encourage little Rohan to serve the nation too.” “Don't speak like this son!, My son is very brave, it will require more than just a bullet to kill my son, it will require the barbarity of Satan to kill a soldier. I still have faith in humanity.” “Say yes or No Ma!” “You have just come from duty, and you are talking these silly things. Let me get something for you to eat. You must be hungry. It's been long since I fed my son.” “I was on a mission Ma! A mission to save my innocent brothers in Kashmir from getting brainwashed, and those who are brainwashed to get them back home. They​ have this misconception that they are fighting for a cause, my mission is to make them realize that the only cause they should have is the nation, and their selfish bosses are just using them. Nothing else . Now promise me you will let my younger brother Rohan join the army after me.” “Your clock keeps on ticking at the same place. Ohk! Baba, I promise I will encourage Rohan too. No one will be more prouder than me when both of my sons will be in Army.” She said with a big smile. “That's like my mother” Vinay hugged her. “Now I'm very hungry, go get me something to eat.” She happily entered the kitchen, when her mobile phone rang. “Hello! Is this the home of Captain Vinay Kaushik?” The voice on the other side asked. “Yes!” “Ma'am with a heavy heart we inform you that Mr. Vinay Kaushik is no more . His body was found near Forests in Kupwara in a mutilated condition. The terrorists tortured him to death.” “What rubbish you are talking? He is at his home. Wait let me give the phone to him. Vinay beta!!! Look , someone wants to talk to you.” She stormed out of the Kitchen only to find him gone… ...…. That's it. It's my first time writing a story. Dedicated to all the soldiers and​ their families behind. Follow Smriti for more. Till then Happy Reading.

“I never thought even in my wildest dreams that few A4 sheets can break down my entire family in to tears. “Don't worry we will fight back” said my father in a mild voice trying to instill confidence to my grandparents and my mother. “We are lower middle class, your salary nor our savings will help to bring me out of this” said my mother with each drop of tear wetting her cheeks, which I haven't seen before. I never thought that I would see my angel in death pain due chemos over chemos. I never thought that I would see her losing her hair due to injections and radiotherapy. I never thought that we would see her in intensive care unit. I never imagined that my mother had so much of will power to fight the deadly disease called cancer. She was indeed a warrior who fought death with only love for us. Can someone take so much of pain ? Yes, mother's can. Anybody can fight cancer and be a survivor, all that we need is a will power and support. As my father was my mom's back bone. I hope and pray every cancer patient has a support. And our team will support you. If my mother can fight, you all can fight. Let's live our life as survivors, as warriors.” Her speech ended in a “Fighting against cancer camping” as the crowd cheered. As her proud mother and father stood in a corner as audience. Listening to their daughter as an oncologist. Cheers :)

“ I never thought this would effect me that much.” Thought Sejal. Her inner voice was bombarding all these questions at her. Why the hell she is expecting an explanation from Prateek. The reason for not showing up that day? Why she is justifying his act and making up excuses for him. Why she is not able to accept the fact that he was also no different from the others. Thinking about Prateek , she dozed off.  On the other side, Prateek was fighting up his will to message Sejal. He was thinking.. What he did was not acceptable , but what would he say to her.? Will she allow him to apologize for this behaviour? But , what will he say to her ? “ What was the reason he didn't showed up at the café that day.?” The reason, he himself was unsure of.  It's previous part is.. Geeta Pankaj's answer to Can you write a story starting with "It was the first time…"?

“I never thought this would happen again”, Layra exclaimed. "What happen", asked Arohi (Best Friend) Arohi was alert. What happen again? Why is Layra so tensed. "I hate love", Layra screamed "From last one year, I am listening same", Arohi said. Layra was madly in love with a best guy but had a break up due to some unforeseen situation. "What happen now, you have many other proposals pending. Why can't you accept anyone?", Arohi asked. Arohi knows, Layra needs someone. But Layra don't want to move on or accept any proposal. "CAN LOVE HAPPEN TWICE?", Layra asked (surprisingly) "Yeah. But I don't know why its not happening with you", Arohi replied. As (one of Arohi's friend) Abhi loves Layra unexceptionally but Layra seems confused. "I started loving Arnav", screamed Layra. "What? Can you repeat it again", Arohi asked Arohi is shocked as Abhi was doing everything to make Layra happy from last one year & she never fell in love with Abhi. Arnav meets arohi last month & in this one month, Arnav never did something to make her special than why Layra loves Arnav. "Are you sure?", Arohi asked again Tears start rolling down from Layra's eyes "Yes. I love him", Layra said Arohi questioned herself "What is love? How someone fell in love just in one month while not with another person in one year." Love smiled in corner after listening conversation. “Love happens unexpectedly anytime. It never seeks for anybody's permission nor time bounds love” Finally both understands Blithe!!

I never thought it was possible. I had always doubted their coexistence. When one said 100, the other wanted 38. When the other asked about 4, the first one barked 39. I was sure that there didn’t exist a thing over which both of them would agree. The differences seemed stark, and their relationship irreconcilable. Would they ever get together? I had lost all hope. But when all seemed frosty, they found faith. It was cold, their equation hard, but then Kelvin walked in with a 233.15 and magic happened. ‘Minus forty?’, cried Celsius, eyes glittering with anticipation. The words had struck like lightening. With lips trembling, ‘Eureka!’, cried Fahrenheit. Tears of joy froze before they fell. But, it no longer mattered, their embrace was warm. Both Celsius and Fahrenheit were finally at peace. Kelvin smiled from a distance.

She (In tears) - I never thought somebody can love a ‘gang-rape’ victim like me with whole heart. He - What? Are you seriously a gang-rape victim? She - Yes. Why? Any issue. He - No actually, my parents won’t allow for inter-caste marriage. So, we should leave and bury our love here itself. She - Are you sure? Don’t you love me? He - Yes, I do love you but I can’t go against the wish of my parents (And he walked away). He was the 6th guy who proposed her and promised for loving unconditionally. But similar to others, he too left her after listening to the gang-rape story. This was the false story that she projected every-time to check the ‘Unconditional Love’. Now, she doubted if any such thing really existed.

‘I never thought I could see you again', a mother said to her son who is back home from death bed. Going back to what has happened a month ago, Ram was a 3rd year btech student from a college which is in the outskirts of the city he lives in. He hails from middle class background while his friends are from rich and upper middle class families. The friends gang decided to buy sports bike for each one of them and all of them being rich could afford them. Every member of the gang now has a bike except Ram. Out of peer pressure, he started getting into arguments with his dad every now and then for a bike. But his father refused to buy him a bike not because he dint want to, but he is still paying EMIs for a house which he bought 10 years ago. “Aakhir aakhir baap baap hota hai”. After a week long arguments, fights, Ram's father bought him a bike similar to what his friends had. Things were all set and it's been a week since Ram is the owner of his bike and it was celebration time for the gang. They decide to throw themselves a party in a farm house in the outskirts of the city and the celebrations were on. In the middle of the night, they realised they were out of drinks and wanted more. Ram decided to go out and get the drinks from an outlet nearby. He had to rush because the outlet would be close by 11:00 pm and it was already 10:45. He started his bike, after reaching halfway he realized he forgot to get the money. The time which he had was very less, so he started razing towards the place to get the money in the wrong direction. His senses couldn't judge a bus coming from the opposite direction and he hit the bus. He fell unconscious lying in the pool of blood and bike shattered to pieces. He woke up in the hospital bed to see himself with an oxygen mask on and broken leg. After a month long efforts by the doctor he felt better and was discharged from the hospital. His mother hugged him and said, “I never thought I could see you again”.

"I never thought I would be happy again", Payel said, while her head rested on the lap of Vinay. They both are in the city park, meeting after a long time. Vinay said," I had to leave urgently. I could not tell anybody, not even you". Payel with an irritated expression," Why don't you leave this job." "I can't, that is my bread and butter",Vinay said. Payel replied," What if your next job is me?". Vinay takes out a handkerchief laced with chloroform and covers her mouth and nose and whisper in her ears,"I will do exactly the same".

“I never thought…..” A love story would end even like this This story is of my friend which I am writing We are currently in 3rd year mechanical, as like once upon a time…. Story, my friend (say Krishna) fell in love with a girl from computer science department (let she be Rukmini….) The one who always been with us, started to go to her class whenever there was time, he even stopped having lunch with us. We were like fine he is in love let him enjoy…. Sometimes he would come and say macha she has become my closest one, she is my future, she is the one I was looking all these days…. Days went well…. After 2–3 months Krishna: Hi macha, yeno madtidya…. Oota maadana Baro ( hi dude, what are you doing, come let's have lunch) Me: yaakappa, nav evathu nenpadva ninge ( what man, u have remembered us now) Krishna: Ella macha, break up maadkonde Kano☹️ ( no dude, I broke up with her) Here it comes…. Me: yako, yen aythu ( why, what happened) Krishna: macha avalu 2 months doddavlu Kano nangintha…. Future sari eralla macha…. Adke beda andbitte (dude she is 2 months elder than me, I don't find any future with her, so I broke up with her today) This was the 1st time I heard something like this and what does love have to do with it… n that too 2 months. People it's not love that's making this generation go out of way… it's you who has given that dimension for love n everyone are seeing it that way…. Grow up for God sake, love is something sacred that can be experienced…. Don't spoil it please…. Happy…

I never thought I should again to go to school.. Background : I was studying LKG. At the end of the academic year, I got viral fever. So I was at home for almost 10days. Writing final exams was not mandatory for an LKG student in those days. So final exams got completed and summer holidays were declared. One fine day my brother came home and told me school got completed and I need not go to school. I felt so happy. I thought that I completed my education and need not go to school at all (such a dumb kid I was). I started enjoying holidays like there is no tomorrow. One day when I came home after playing, my mom was talking to a neighbour that school will start again from tomorrow. I got numb for few seconds and my whole world seems to shatter. It took me some more years to understand how dumb I was. :-P

I never thought I am capable enough to earn a good amount of money. This is not a story. It's about my life. It's not like I am earning for the first time and happy about it. I worked in corporate for 6 years but was never appreciated for work, salary was very less and long working hours. I was never happy with my salary. So one day I finally decided to quit my job and do something of my own. Today I am working as a freelancer and earning 80–90 k per month. I am not bragging about it. I am just saying we should always do what we love. Hard work always paid off. Getting a freelancing project is not easy but I had decided I will have to get good projects and a respectable amount of money for myself.

“I never thought I will cry for her, but today I am unable to control myself”. She was getting married, she was on stage with a smile holding a garland in her hand for jaimala ceremony. They both exchanged their garland and get married, everyone started clapping, showering of flowers take place and then one by one everyone went for blessing to newly married couple. Everyone seems to be happy and deep inside I was happy too, but here I was standing in a corner with a heavy heart. Suddenly my friend noticed me and tried his best to make me feel better but his efforts had no effect on me, and then I brust into tears. Deep inside I was happy for her, but…. I don't want to let her go, every single memory flashed in front of my eyes. Her eyes was searching for me, and somehow she managed to find my presence. I noticed she had tears in her eyes too. I went there hugged her tightly and we both broke into tears. That day I got to know about bonding of sister-brother. -RJ
